page.title: 16LOCAL NEWS:PILLAR BOX SAVED.
page.content: {PARKMINSTER VICTORIAN PILLAR BOX.} This letterbox was built in 1861 and is one of the two oldest remaining in Sussex.In 1984 The Post Office demolished the box and replaced it with a modern one 200 yards along the road.Owing to the cost of rebuilding the brick pillar The Post Office were unable to use the original box.The Cowfold Society offered to rebuild the pillar if the original postbox could be used,The Post Office agreed.Bricks were donated by various local people and Fowler Bros.a local building firm rebuilt the brick pillar.On May 17, 1985.the letter box was reopened.The Horsham Museum loaned a pentacycle,a "Hen & Chicken"and a Victorian Postman's Uniform.The Post Office sent a postman to make the first collection from the rebuilt box.A Commemorative Envelope was issued.
